reviews.text: Trains are usually on time and flow through the station is good. The staff are friendly when I've spoken to them. Don't forget that there's an escalator that can take you straight from the northern line to the Wirral line. Also maps massively underestimates time from walking between the lines so you may make an earlier transfer than it says.

Centre of city so very convenient. However does not accept e-tickets currently. So you either have to collect your booked tickets from Lime Street station (20 minutes return walk) or buy tickets in either of the grocery shops.

The train was delayed and where it arrived it was dirty and and after leaving the train and asking where to pay I was told buy a very aggressive security guard I had to pay a fine because I was 'fare evading' even though there was no one on the train collecting the fares. Also it isn't very central and isn't Liverpool's main station

Great trainstation, i am just very scared of the mass level of homeless people outside of the station, asking me for my life savings, i am only in college, and they expect me to have money, a very scary man keeps coming up to me and it sends a great deal of trepidation down my spine as i quiver in my boots. Overall great station, good trains to jump in front of xD, and yeah, good greggs too, would recommend for a cheeky 24 hour fort challenge, ygm?
Very helpful staff and clear signs
